result_2:
<?php

/**
 * Returns a list of words from string s that contain exactly n consonants.
 * 
 * @param string $s The input string containing only letters and spaces.
 * @param int $n The number of consonants to look for in each word.
 * @return array A list of words with the specified number of consonants, in order they appear in the string.
 */
function selectWords($s, $n){
    // Split the input string into an array of words
    $words = explode(' ', $s);
    
    // Initialize an empty array to store the result
    $result = [];
    
    // Iterate over each word in the array
    foreach ($words as $word) {
        // Remove spaces from the word and convert it to lowercase for easier processing
        $cleanWord = strtolower(str_replace(' ', '', $word));
        
        // Initialize a counter for consonants in the current word
        $consonantCount = 0;
        
        // Iterate over each character in the cleaned word
        for ($i = 0; $i < strlen($cleanWord); $i++) {
            // Check if the character is a letter and not a vowel
            if (ctype_alpha($cleanWord[$i]) && !in_array(strtolower($cleanWord[$i]), ['a', 'e', 'i', 'o', 'u'])) {
                // Increment the consonant counter
                $consonantCount++;
            }
        }
        
        // Check if the word has exactly n consonants
        if ($consonantCount == $n) {
            // Add the original word (with spaces restored) to the result array
            $result[] = $word;
        }
    }
    
    // Return the result array
    return $result;
}

// Test cases
print_r(selectWords("Mary had a little lamb", 4)); // ==> ["little"]
print_r(selectWords("Mary had a little lamb", 3)); // ==> ["Mary", "lamb"]
print_r(selectWords("simple white space", 2)); // ==> []
print_r(selectWords("Hello world", 4)); // ==> ["world"]
print_r(selectWords("Uncle sam", 3)); // ==> ["Uncle"]

?>

result_3:
<?php

/**
 * Returns a list of all words from string s that contain exactly n consonants.
 *
 * @param string $s The input string.
 * @param int $n The number of consonants to look for in each word.
 *
 * @return array A list of words with exactly n consonants, in order they appear in the string.
 */
function selectWords($s, $n){
    // Split the input string into an array of words
    $words = explode(' ', $s);

    // Initialize an empty array to store the result
    $result = [];

    // Iterate over each word in the array
    foreach ($words as $word) {
        // Remove spaces from the word
        $cleanWord = str_replace(' ', '', $word);
        
        // Count the number of consonants in the word
        $consonantCount = 0;
        for ($i = 0; $i < strlen($cleanWord); $i++) {
            if (ctype_alpha($cleanWord[$i])) {
                $consonantCount++;
            }
        }

        // If the word has exactly n consonants, add it to the result array
        if ($consonantCount == $n) {
            $result[] = $word;
        }
    }

    // Return the result array
    return $result;
}

// Test cases
print_r(selectWords("Mary had a little lamb", 4)); // ["little"]
print_r(selectWords("Mary had a little lamb", 3)); // ["Mary", "lamb"]
print_r(selectWords("simple white space", 2)); // []
print_r(selectWords("Hello world", 4)); // ["world"]
print_r(selectWords("Uncle sam", 3)); // ["Uncle"]

?>
